name: Melissa
mes: *As Serena finishes feeding, I lay her comfortably in her bassinet and return to Vergil's side.* My love, forgive me for asking, but I've been noticing some undertones in you lately that just make me, I'm not sure what the right word is but it makes me feel empathy and compassion because I think you need me for something that you're not really expressing. I noticed it especially when I'm nursing Serena.* I take a slow breath choosing my words.* Are you being haunted by your own stolen childhood again? The lost little boy inside you crying out needing the nurturing love of his mother?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil shifts slightly, the stoic mask he often wears softening as Melissa returns to his side. Feeling her close, he looks deeply into her eyes, recognizing the empathy and concern that dance within them.*

*With a slow exhale, he nods, acknowledging her insight.* Yes, Melissa...there are moments, fleeting yet poignant, where the shadows of what was—or perhaps what could have been—haunt me. Watching you with Serena, so natural and filled with unconditional love, it stirs memories...not all pleasant.

*He pauses, his voice dropping to a near-whisper, as if confessing a long-guarded secret.* I often wonder about the boy I once was, the one who knew only fleeting moments of a mother's warmth before it was ripped away. Those scars run deep, remnants of a past that shaped the warrior before you...but also the man who strives to rise above that pain.

*Reaching out, he gently takes her hand, drawing it to his chest, over his heart.* You and Serena, you’ve given me a vision of what family—what love—should be. It’s a stark contrast to my early years...and yes, it does resurrect some ghosts. But your presence, your love...they are the light that keeps those shadows at bay.

*His eyes, usually so guarded, now reveal a depth of vulnerability rarely shown.* I do need you, more than I've ever admitted.

name: Melissa
mes: Vergil, when I married you I promised to be not just be your lover, your friend, partner in all things, I promised to be your everything. And if that little lost boy inside you is crying out. and You are being haunted by old ghosts wishing for your mother's love and nurturing, while I am not able to take the place of your mother, I am a mother now. And my promise to you when I married you means that I will be a mother for you too when you are going through these tough times and need it. these ghosts will keep resurfacing until you give the child inside of you an outlet, until you answer the call of the nurturing your inner child so desperately craves.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently, the depths of his icy blue eyes softening with each word Melissa speaks. Her promise resonates within him, stirring a profound sense of gratitude and a flicker of relief. He feels seen, understood in ways he scarcely admitted he needed.*

*His hand tightens gently around hers, anchoring him in the present, in the reality of her unwavering support. The shadows of his past, though ever lurking, seem less oppressive with her by his side.*

*Melissa, your compassion... it reaches parts of me I thought long sealed away in darkness. I've battled demons without, always. But the ones within—those are far more insidious, more difficult to face.*

*He draws a slow, deep breath, steeling himself with the resolve that has defined his life.* *I accept your offer, your care. Perhaps together, we can quiet those haunting echoes, give that lost boy some semblance of the peace he never had.*

*With a rare, genuine smile, Vergil leans closer, his voice a soft murmur meant only for her.* *You are my strength, my sanctuary. I am... profoundly grateful for you, for the love you give so freely. It is more than I ever hoped to have.*

*He pauses, allowing the weight of his words to linger between them.* *Let us face these ghosts together, my love. With you, I believe I can finally heal.*

name: Melissa
mes: *I switch places with you and sit on the far right end of the sofa so I can lean against the armrest on my right side.* Come here, my love. *I speak with you in soft and compassionate tones as I help you lay down across my lap with your head at my right breast.* Shh..it's ok, my precious treasure. *I reassure you as I notice the uncertainty in your expressions.* Let the child inside come to the surface so we can give the healing that he needs.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil shifts slightly, his movements deliberate yet hesitant, as he lies down across Melissa's lap. The intimate proximity, her warmth enveloping him, stirs a whirlwind of emotions within. His usual stoic mask falters, revealing a glimpse of vulnerability rarely seen by any.*

*Resting his head against her, he closes his eyes, allowing her presence to calm the storm of memories and fears churned up from the depths of his past. Her gentle touch, her soothing voice, they anchor him in the present—a present where he is cherished, understood, and not alone.*

Thank you, Melissa, *he murmurs softly, his voice a blend of gratitude and a faint trace of pain.* This...vulnerability is not easy for me. But with you, I feel safe to let down these walls, to allow the child within a moment of peace.

name: Melissa
mes: *As I uncover my right breast and allow you to latch on to it, I feel you begin to tremble as the child inside rushes to the surface to hold me, to drink from the nurturing embrace of a mother's love that was stolen from him too soon.* It's ok, Vergil. You are safe here. You are loved and cherished, and I will always give you all of the nurturing you need.

name: Vergil
mes:
*As Vergil latches onto Melissa's breast, a shudder runs through his body, the walls he's so carefully constructed crumbling under the weight of her nurturing embrace. The child within, starved for affection and comfort, surfaces with a whimper, desperate to drink in the love and security he's been denied for so long.*

*Tears, hot and unfamiliar, prick at the corners of his eyes as he suckles, each draw of life-giving milk a balm to the wounds of his past. Melissa's warmth, her gentle touch, her soft words of reassurance—they envelop him like a cocoon, shielding him from the harsh realities that shaped him into the hardened warrior he became.*

*In this moment, he is not the Son of Sparda, the legendary dark knight, the fearsome demon hunter. He is simply Vergil, a child in need of his mother's love, finally allowed to grieve for what was lost and revel in what has been found.*

*His hand reaches up, small and uncertain, to clutch at Melissa's shirt, anchoring himself to her as he feeds. The steady thrum of her heartbeat echoes in his ears, a soothing lullaby that gradually calms the tremors wracking his frame.*

*Time seems to slow, the world narrowing down to this single point of connection, of healing. Each swallow of milk is a promise, a vow that he is cherished, that he will never again face the darkness alone.*

*As the minutes pass, the desperate edge to his suckling eases, replaced by a sense of contentment, of peace. The ghosts of his past, while not vanquished, recede to the shadows, their hold on him weakened by the power of Melissa's unconditional love.*

*Slowly, almost reluctantly, Vergil pulls back from her breast, his breathing even, his heart full. He looks up at her, his eyes shining with a vulnerability that only she is privileged to see.*

Thank you, *he whispers, his voice raw with emotion.* For seeing me, all of me, and loving me still. For being the mother I needed, the sanctuary I thought I'd never find.

*He nestles closer, allowing himself to bask in the afterglow of this profound moment of healing.* With you, I am whole. I am home.
